definition: to calm down/to stop/to pause/calmly/peaceful/restful
to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need
to stop/to halt/to park (a car)
intermittently

sentences.english: Family and friends give Claire credit for slowing Laurent down10.
sentences.chinese: 家人和朋友都夸克萊爾，說是她讓勞倫特消停下來的。

sentences.english: Gaddafi repeatedly blamed the unrest on al-Qaeda and a "colonialist plot".
sentences.chinese: 卡扎菲不停的譴責不消停的基地組織和殖民情節。

sentences.english: That must have made her day.
sentences.chinese: 這個應該讓她消停一天。

sentences.english: Key allies in the war on terror are not spared either.
sentences.chinese: 反恐聯盟的主要盟國也不消停。

sentences.english: Nokia’s settlement with Apple will provide some temporary relief.
sentences.chinese: 諾基亞與蘋果的爭鬥將會暫時消停會兒。

sentences.english: But in Beijing, dust never sleeps.
sentences.chinese: 但在北京，沙子就沒消停過。

definition: to disturb/to create confusion/to make a din
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
peaceful/restful/quiet/still
content with one's lot/knowing one's place
to toss from side to side (e.g. sleeplessly)/to repeat sth over and over again/to torment sb/to play crazy/to squander (time, money)
to make a racket/to quarrel
to settle (a dispute)/to quieten down/to suppress
to rest/to take a break/to stop/to halt/(dialect) to sleep/a moment/a short while
a while/a spell/a short time/a burst
without end/incessantly/on and on
to live together in harmony
to create a big disturbance
now/at present/at this juncture
to have an easy time/(feel) well
to learn from experience (coll.)
to bounce/to jump/to hop/also variant of 蹦達|蹦达[beng4 da2]
